it.unica.jpc.datasets

Class Dataset

  • java.lang.Object
    • it.unica.jpc.datasets.Dataset
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Movielens

    public abstract class Dataset
extends java.lang.Object
    Represents a generic collection of data. This class implements an algorithm of stratified k-fold cross-validation.
    Author:
    Fabio Colella

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Dataset()
      Creates a dataset with default values.
      Dataset(java.io.File sourceFile)
      Creates a dataset from the given source file.

    • Method Detail

      • loadDataset

        public abstract boolean loadDataset(java.io.File sourceFile)
        Loads data from a specified source.
        Parameters:
        sourceFile - the file from which to load the data
        Returns:
        true if the loading completed without errors

      • getTestSet

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> getTestSet(int layersAmount,
                                                                 double testPecentage)
        Gets the test set of a k-fold cross-validation.
        Parameters:
        layersAmount - the number of layers for the stratified k-fold algorithm (Precondition: layersAmount >= 1) A layerAmount equal to 1 means you're doing a non stratified k-fold.
        testPecentage - percentage of the dataset that belong to the test set (Precondition: testPercentage >= 0)
        Returns:
        the elements contained in the test set

      • getDatasetPartition

        public abstract java.util.ArrayList<Triple>[] getDatasetPartition(int k,
                                                                  int layersAmount)
        Gets the partition of the dataset. This method is an implementation of the stratified k-fold cross validation.
        Parameters:
        k - the number of partitons to obtain from the dataset (Precondition: k >= 1) A k value equal to 1 means that no partitioning is being done. A good value for k is 10, as determined by various studies.
        layersAmount - the number of layers for the stratified k-fold algorithm (Precondition: layersAmount >= 1) A layerAmount equal to 1 means you're doing a non stratified k-fold.
        Returns:
        an array of partitions

      • savePartitions

        public abstract void savePartitions(int testSetIndex,
                                    java.lang.String savePath)
        Saves all the partitions in the given directory.
        Parameters:
        testSetIndex - the index of the partition containing the test set (Precondition: testSetIndex >= 0 && testSetIndex <= partitionsAmount - 1
        savePath - the path where the partitions are going to be saved A null path is intended as the current working directory.
